bug.short_desc: py3 coverage: Fatal Python error: deallocating None
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Seen in f24 (python3-coverage-4.2-1.fc24.x86_64). Replication info here:
https://github.com/mikem23/replicate-coverage-bug
Upstream bug here:
https://bitbucket.org/ned/coveragepy/issues/583/fatal-python-error-with-threaded-unit-test
This bug appears to be fixed in version 4.3.2. I was able to confirm this by rebuilding from the f26 branch for f24
https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=19609238
I suspect the bug will also manifest on f25 since the version there is also 4.2.1
python-coverage-4.4.1-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-8001484183
python-coverage-4.4.1-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-6f5c3ec36e

python-coverage-4.4.1-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-6f5c3ec36e

python-coverage-4.4.1-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-8001484183
python-coverage-4.4.1-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
python-coverage-4.4.1-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
